bibl.title: Dispatch from John G. Willis to William H. Seward
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.ab:
No 14
United States Commercial Agency
Loanda April 29 1861
div1.p:
Sir,
Under date of April 5th I had the honor of addressing you under care of the U S Minister at Lisbon.

I now enclose Returns from this Commercial Agency to the Quarter ending March 31 '61. The several accounts & certificates I have directed to the Treasury Department I have drawn on the Honorable Secretary of the Treasury for $223.39 being balance of my Salary for that Quarter.

In my Letter of April 5 I informed you of the particulars respecting Mr E A Birnie, U S Naval Shopkeeper & have now to add that he still remains in Prison without as yet any evident signs of a quick despatch of his cases by the Judicial author- ities
ities of this place.

I having received some time since Leave of Absence from the State Department it is my intention to take passage for Salem Mass in a few days & have placed the Business relating to the Commercial Agency in charge of Mr Robert Cunningham who has been recognised as Acting U S Com Agent by the Govenor General of this Province.

On my arrival at Salem I will inform the Department & if required will visit Washington in order to give further particulars respecting Slave Trade. Imprisonment of Mr Birnie & Removal of the U S Depot for the African Squadron.

closer.signed:
John G Willis
U S Com Agent

address.addrLine: Secretary of State U S A
